problem_text: This is a GeomVerse problem. If the length of the height perpendicular to the AB base in the ABC triangle is 9, compute the area of the ABC triangle. Round computations to 2 decimal places.
code:
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib.patches as patches
import numpy as np

# Coordinates
A = (34.23, 34.23)
B = (34.23, 5691.08)
C = (8060.939999999999, 12705.929999999998)
D = (-6965.77, 34.23)

# Create figure and axis
fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(10, 8))

# Draw the orange triangle (A, B, C)
orange_triangle = patches.Polygon([A, B, C], closed=True, color="orange", alpha=0.6)
ax.add_patch(orange_triangle)

# Draw the gray triangle (A, B, D)
gray_triangle = patches.Polygon([A, B, D], closed=True, color="gray", alpha=0.6)
ax.add_patch(gray_triangle)

# Draw right-angle marker
def draw_right_angle(ax, p1, p2, p3, size=1.0, color="gray", alpha=0.8):
    '''Draw a right-angle marker at the corner defined by p1, p2, and p3.'''
    v1 = np.array(p1) - np.array(p2)
    v2 = np.array(p3) - np.array(p2)
    v1 = v1 / np.linalg.norm(v1) * size
    v2 = v2 / np.linalg.norm(v2) * size
    marker = patches.Polygon(
        [p2, p2 + v1, p2 + v1 + v2, p2 + v2],
        closed=True,
        facecolor=color,
        edgecolor=None,
        alpha=alpha
    )
    ax.add_patch(marker)

# Add right-angle marker
draw_right_angle(ax, B, A, D)

# Add labels
ax.text(A[0], A[1], "A", fontsize=16, ha="right", va="top")
ax.text(B[0], B[1], "B", fontsize=16, ha="right", va="bottom")
ax.text(C[0], C[1], "C", fontsize=16, ha="left", va="bottom")
ax.text(D[0], D[1], "D", fontsize=16, ha="right", va="top")

# -- LENGTH ANNOTATION -- #
ax.text((A[0] + D[0]) / 2, (A[1] + D[1]) / 2, "7", fontsize=16, ha="center", va="top")
ax.text((B[0] + D[0]) / 2, (B[1] + D[1]) / 2, "9", fontsize=16, ha="center", va="bottom")

# Configure the plot
ax.set_xlim(-9965.77, 15034.23)
ax.set_ylim(-4965.77, 15034.23)
ax.set_aspect("equal")
ax.axis("off")

# Show the plot
plt.show()

ext_info.cot: The length of the hypotenuse of the ABD triangle is 9 and the length of the AD side is 7, so the length of the AB side is $\sqrt{9^2 - 7^2} = \sqrt{81 - 49} = \sqrt{32} = 5.66$. For the ABC triangle, the length of the AB base is 5.66 and its corresponding height is 9 so the area is $\frac{5.66 * 9}{2} = \frac{50.94}{2} = 25.47$. Therefore the final answer is 25.47.
